title: chore: release crates
body:
<!--
Before submitting a PR, please read http://deno.land/manual/contributing

1. Give the PR a descriptive title.

  Examples of good title:
    - fix(std/http): Fix race condition in server
    - docs(console): Update docstrings
    - feat(doc): Handle nested reexports

  Examples of bad title:
    - fix #7123
    - update docs
    - fix bugs

2. Ensure there is a related issue and it is referenced in the PR text.
3. Ensure there are tests that cover the changes.
4. Ensure `cargo test` passes.
5. Ensure `./tools/format.js` passes without changing files.
6. Ensure `./tools/lint.js` passes.
-->

title: chore(wpt): Mark a WPT test as failed if it exits before completion
body:
Currently, a WPT test is considered failed if its status code is anything other than 0, regardless of whether the test suite completed running or not, and any subtests that haven't finished running are not considered to be failures.

But a test can exit with a zero status code before it has completed running, if the event loop has run out of tasks because of a bug in one of the ops, leading to false positives. This change fixes that.

<!--
Before submitting a PR, please read http://deno.land/manual/contributing

1. Give the PR a descriptive title.

  Examples of good title:
    - fix(std/http): Fix race condition in server
    - docs(console): Update docstrings
    - feat(doc): Handle nested reexports

  Examples of bad title:
    - fix #7123
    - update docs
    - fix bugs

2. Ensure there is a related issue and it is referenced in the PR text.
3. Ensure there are tests that cover the changes.
4. Ensure `cargo test` passes.
5. Ensure `./tools/format.js` passes without changing files.
6. Ensure `./tools/lint.js` passes.
-->

title: chore: remove test files
body: Sorry!

title: docs(runtime): fix link to API docs
body: fixes https://github.com/denoland/doc_website/issues/214

title: refactor(cli/tools/coverage): strongly type inspector values
body: This adds local methods and types for the rest of the messages, parameters and return objects that coverage uses as a first pass towards a fully typed unified inspector client interface.

title: feat(repl): support autocomplete on declarations containing a primitive
body:
These now work:

```ts
let str = "cow"
str.<tab>
let num = 5;
num.<tab>
5n.<tab>
let func = function test(){};
func.<tab>
```

Unfortunately the following still does not work (it doesn't work in node's repl either and it would require improving `get_expr_from_line_at_pos` to probably tokenize to properly find the expression):

```ts
"test".<tab>
```

Closes #11322

title: perf(core): avoid extra alloc in Deno.core.encode()
body:
An optimization to the `encode()` binding, avoiding an extra alloc & copy, extracted from https://github.com/denoland/deno/pull/10532

Will likely need a lower level `encode/decode` benchmark to measure the delta of this change

title: fix(docs): update contributing instructions to mention installing python 3 instead of 2
body: As title.

title: feat: Add support for "deno test --fail-fast=N"
body:
Allow to specify upon n number of failing test for fail-fast flag please see #11124 discussion
By default fail-fast will stop on first error.

title: feat(extensions/crypto): implement verify() for RSA
body:
Towards #1891

Introduces `SubtleCrypto.verify` for RSA algorithms (`RSASSA-PKCS1-v1_5` and `RSA-PSS`)

Originally the plan was to implement all current algorithms supported by `sign()` in this PR but we can't enable WPT for both the methods because it relies on `SubtleCrypto.importKey`.

title: fix(cli/tools/lint): output json reports to stdout
body: This changes the output stream for `--json` to stdout rather than stderr keeping stderr free for diagnostics output without poisoning the requested json output.

title: fix: fix inspecting prototypes of classes with custom inspect implementations
fix(cli/tools/upgrade): check if passed version is valid
body:
Closes #11237
Also minor clean up that didnt feel like a separate PR was necesary

title: refactor: use primordials for extensions/crypto
body: Towards #11224

title: fix(cli): make --doc work with --watch
body:
This implements support for using the `--doc` along side the `--watch` option.

Closes https://github.com/denoland/deno/issues/10599

title: feat(cli/tools/test_runner): add terse reporter
body: This adds a terse reporter which displays one character per test instead of one line.

title: feat(core): return v8::Value from JsRuntime::execute_script
body:
This commit changes return type of JsRuntime::execute_script to include
v8::Value returned from evaluation.

When embedding deno_core it is sometimes useful to be able to inspect
script evaluation value without the hoops of adding ops to store the
value on the OpState.

v8::Global<v8::Value> is used so consumers don't have to pass
scope themselves.

Closes https://github.com/denoland/deno/issues/11105

title: docs(manual): split testing into multiple chapters
body:
First pass at splitting the testing document into multiple chapters.

Closes #10840

title: feat(runtime/http): websocket support
body: Closes #10211
